result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah Michael Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Civil Arrest/Body Execution, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Modification or Change in Sentence; Approved so long as no cost to Chippewa County.
Income Assignment Order for Unpaid Fines and Other Financial Penalties

Defendant Jeremiah Michael Johnson in court with attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Chad David Verbeten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  court minutes filed. re: Count 1 - defendant enters no contest plea.   Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.  Defendant informed of charges and penalties.  Factual basis and probable cause found.  Court accepts pleas as voluntarily and knowingly and intelligently made. Sentencing: 6 months jail with huber; to begin no later than 9/30/16 at 7pm. 52 days credit. Can be served in Barron Co. if no cost to Chippewa County. Costs totaling $243 to be paid within 30 days.
Plea hearing on September 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.
